abstract.text: A sequence that represents a single execution of an asynchronous unit of work.
Collects all received elements, and emits a single array of the collection when the upstream sequence finishes.
Type erases the current sequence, useful when you need a concrete type that’s easy to predict.
Encodes the output from upstream using a specified encoder.
Catches any errors emitted by the upstream
and handles them using the provided closure.
Executes the current async sequence and returns an AnyCancellable token to cancel the subscription.
Introduces a breakpoint into the async sequence when an error occurs.
Tries to catch any errors emitted by the upstream
and handles them using the provided throwing closure.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times.
Replaces any errors from the upstream
with the provided value.
Tries to catch a specific type of error emitted by the upstream
and handles them using the provided throwing closure.
Logs events from the upstream
to the console.
Transforms the error produced by the
Emits either the first or latest element received during a specified amount of time.
Delays delivery of all output to the downstream receiver by a specified amount of time
Discards the output values from the upstream
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times only when a specific error occurs.
Replaces any
values from the upstream
with the provided non-nil value.
Raises a fatal error when its upstream sequence fails, and otherwise republishes all received input.
Catches a specific type of error emitted by the upstream
and handles them using the provided closure.
Adds side-effects to the receiving events of the upstream
Introduces a breakpoint into the async sequence.
Returns the first element of the sequence
Transforms the elements, completion, and errors of the current
into
values.
Transforms a sequence of
values back into their original form in an
Decodes the output from the upstream using a specified decoder.
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times while applying a transformation on error.

Delays delivery of all output to the downstream receiver by a specified amount of time
Retries the upstream
up to a specified number of times only when a specific error occurs, while applying a transformation on error.
